Package cp213

Class AVL<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
cp213.BST<T>
cp213.AVL<T>
public class AVL<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends BST<T>
Implements an AVL (Adelson-Velsky Landis) tree. Extends BST.
Version:
2021-07-05
Author:
your name here, David Brown

  • Method Details

    • balance

      private int balance​(TreeNode<T> node)
      Returns the balance value of node. If greater than 1, then left heavy, if less than -1, then right heavy. If in the range -1 to 1 inclusive, the node is balanced. Used to determine whether to rotate a node upon insertion.
      Parameters:
      node - The TreeNode to analyze for balance.
      Returns:
      A balance number.

    • rotateLeft

      private TreeNode<T> rotateLeft​(TreeNode<T> node)
      Performs a left rotation around node.
      Parameters:
      node - The subtree to rotate.
      Returns:
      The new root of the subtree.

    • rotateRight

      private TreeNode<T> rotateRight​(TreeNode<T> node)
      Performs a right rotation around node.
      Parameters:
      node - The subtree to rotate.
      Returns:
      The new root of the subtree.

    • insertAux

      protected TreeNode<T> insertAux​(TreeNode<T> node, CountedValue<T> data)
      Auxiliary method for insert. Inserts data into this AVL.
      Overrides:
      insertAux in class BST<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
      Parameters:
      node - the current node (TreeNode)
      data - Data to be inserted into the node
      Returns:
      The inserted node.

    • isValidAux

      protected boolean isValidAux​(TreeNode<T> node)
      Auxiliary method for valid. Determines if a subtree based on node is a valid subtree. An AVL must meet the BST validation conditions, and additionally be balanced in all its subtrees - i.e. the difference in height between any two children must be no greater than 1.
      Overrides:
      isValidAux in class BST<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
      Parameters:
      node - The root of the subtree to test for validity.
      Returns:
      true if the subtree base on node is valid, false otherwise.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(AVL<T> target)
      Determines whether two AVLs are identical.
      Parameters:
      target - The AVL to compare this AVL against.
      Returns:
      true if this AVL and target contain nodes that match in position, value, count, and height, false otherwise.
